subject: Business
title: Strategy vs. Tactics: The Crucial Difference
description: A short lesson to help you apply Strategy vs. Tactics: The Crucial Difference.

hook.text: A company runs 50 marketing campaigns. All succeed individually. Revenue still drops. Why?

buildup.text: Tactics are the actions you take. Strategy is why you take them and how they connect.

discovery.text: Winning tactics without a strategy is like winning battles in a war you're losing.

twist.text: Most companies mistake busyness for strategy. A packed calendar and a clear strategy are different things.

climax.text: Good strategy says no to many good tactics. It focuses resources on the few that compound.

punchline.text: Strategy decides what you won't do. That's its hardest job.

quiz.question: What separates strategy from tactics?
options: Strategy is the overarching plan; tactics are the individual actions
Strategy is short-term; tactics are long-term
Strategy and tactics are the same thing
